climbs.name: The Tallest Man
climbs.fa: Matt D., Dave Hug, Bryan Haberberger

content.description: Pull through the hanging bloc and begin up the face. Lay it back and hike though the arching flake to eventually mantle over the top and reach the anchor
content.location: Directly right of The Ring Neck

climbs.name: State Sponsored
climbs.fa: Molly Gabel, Dave Hug, Dan Rapp, Jim Thurmond, Eric Ulner, Alan

content.description: Climb the the short hanging bloc section to reach the dihedral face. Begin up, and eventually reach and pull around the right. Climb the last section and reach the anchor

climbs.name: The Ring Neck
climbs.fa: Molly Gabel,  Dave Hug, Bryan Haberberger

content.description: Pull through the hanging bloc and gain better stone. Ease your way through tricky moves and eventually mantle over the top to reach the anchor.

climbs.name: Rapp Crack AKA Numero Uno
climbs.fa: Dan Rapp, Eric Ulner, Jim Thurmond, Dave Hug

content.description: climb the rightward crack to the anchor

climbs.name: Keep Up Youth!
climbs.fa: Dan Rapp, Eric Ulner, Jim Thurmond, Dave Hug

content.description: Climb the crack to the anchor

climbs.name: The Great River Road
climbs.fa: Thaddeus & Ashley Portz & Dave Hug September 2017

content.description:
P1: Begin on The Tallest Man and climb to the second bolt. Continue left clipping bolts as you continue to the Rapp Crack. Protect the crack with gear and work onto the traverse ledge of Dietsche Legacy Ladder. Continue up to the 4th bolt and then traverse left on good/large holds and continue to the anchor of Dan's Dihedral. Belay your party to you from this point.  

  P2: Climb left using the anchors of the Lucky Strike Pillar for protection. Continue by using all of the anchors from Hornbein's Wall until you reach the anchor of Great Green Chute. Belay your party to you from here.  

  P3: Climb left and protect the corner of Horbein's Wall with a cam. Continue protecting yourself by clipping the anchors of the Community Effort Wall. Stop on the ledge at the anchor of Feeding the Hungry for a comfortable belay and bring your party across.   

  P4: Due to a large precarious rock (the has potential to eventually fall) down-climb to the ground and walk left along the actual balcony of Ryan's Balcony. Build an anchor using the two bolts of 50 Shades of Grey to bring your partners across.  

  P5: From the above stated belay, continue left clipping bolts from Vista and The Father Gift to climb into the dihedral corner of Spicy Guacamole. Climb up the face and work left at bolt three onto RIver Night & Flashlights. Continue left protecting with the anchors and build a belay at the anchor of the Hespen Arete.  

  P6: Climb left protecting with the anchors of the routes on the Wall of Wild Things. Build an anchor on the anchor of Sleeping Indian. Bring your party across, and once together. Rappell off the anchor to the ground.
content.protection: Standard rack of cams, quickdraws, and runners to extend/protect corners.
content.location: Begin on The Tallest Man and refer to photos for directions

content.description: Climb through large block jugs into a vertical flake system. Lay it back and work up and right into block jugs on the face. Mantle over the top and reach the anchor.
content.location: First sport route to the left of Dietsche Legacy Ladder. Refer to photo

climbs.name: Fire Chief Variation
climbs.fa: Dan Rapp, Eric Ulner, Jim Thurmond, Dave Hug

content.description:
Climb the left crack to the anchor 

  The First bolted route at Pere Marquette
Begin climbing on the right side of the wall. Climb up and mantle on the ledge, clip in and traverse left. Follow the seam and mantle the top to reach the anchor.

Originally, this route shared anchors withState Sponsored. As of 11/17/17 a new bolt has been added to the right of the anchor of State Sponsored. Clip it and continue to the top for a new anchor.   

  Pull through the hanging bloc face and reach better hold. Send the face until you reach the third bolt, then cut left, clip a bolt and continue to the top for a mantle to the anchor.    She found a dead mouse...
content.location: First route to the right of State Sponsored

climbs.name: Dan's Dihedral
climbs.fa: Dan Rapp, Eric Ulner, Jim Thurmond, Dave Hug

content.description: Climb either crack or both using a variety of moves to reach the anchor
The first wall the trail leads you to
